By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Peters Farms ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Peters Farms management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Peters Farms has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Peters Farms has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Peters Farms now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Peters Farms employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Peters Farms will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Peters Farms facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment.  

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Peters Farms has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Peters Farms emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- California Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR §3220
- Federal Emergency Action Plan - Title 29 CFR §1910.38 
- California Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 §5192(q)
- Federal Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR §1910.120(q)

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.2 Process Descriptions

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Peters Farms operates a commercial cold storage facility for a variety of fruits in Reedley, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
(7) Rooms
(3) Precools
(2) Hallways
(1) Hydrocooler

1.2.2 Facility Location

Peters Farms is located at 41018 Rd 56, Reedley, CA 93654. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 36.535647, -119.447184. The facility is located approximately 7 miles east of state highway 99 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard.
Peters Farms is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Peters Farms has a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Process

The air-cooling evaporators in the Precool 1-3 rooms and Bin Room south zone are supplied from flooded accumulators. Air-cooling evaporators in Rooms 1-2, Storage Rooms 1-4, and the North/South Hallways are supplied by a recirculator. As such, the system is configured for both flooded and pumped overfeed operation.

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Peters Farms has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Peters Farms, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Peters Farms has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                        | Process Chemical                     | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration        Anhydrous Ammonia                25,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.
